TopicTitle: Kerbal Space Program, Curse.com Partner Together For Updated Modding Community Websit

Articles.Content:
<p><a href="http://bit.ly/1jwdoWR"><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/830f15028dae68e7be549f464aa86a8e/tumblr_inline_n55qm4QRI81rr2wit.jpg"/></a></p>

<p><span><span><em>Kerbal Spaceport will now be part of Curse Forge modding community</em></span></span><br/><span>*<br/><strong>Squad</strong>, the developers of the award-winning space agency sim game <strong><a href="http://www.kerbalspaceprogram.com/" target="_blank"><em>Kerbal Space Program</em></a></strong>, announced a partnership with <strong>Curse.com</strong> to partner on a new website for<strong> Kerbal Spaceport</strong>, the host site for the gameÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s popular modding community.<br/> *<br/><span>Starting today, modders will be welcomed to start updating and uploading their <strong><em>KSP </em></strong>game mods to <strong><a href="http://kerbal.curseforge.com/" target="_blank">http://kerbal.curseforge.com</a></strong>. The existing website, <strong><a href="http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/" target="_blank">http://KerbalSpaceport.com</a></strong>, will remain open for modders to transfer their mods to the new site but will no longer be accepting new mods. Players will go to Curse.com to find <strong><em>Kerbal Space Program</em></strong> mods. <br/></span><br/> *<br/><em>Ã¢â‚¬Å“Modders have helped make Kerbal Space Program a more open, more rewarding game experience for our players,Ã¢â‚¬Â </em>Squad chief operating officer Adrian Goya said.<em> Ã¢â‚¬Å“Curse is an important partner because their team is passionate and experienced in caring for and growing online game communities, such as our amazing playerbase for Kerbal Space Program.Ã¢â‚¬Â</em><br/> *<br/> *<em>"We’ve got a great platform and a tremendous team that will be supporting the amazing modders for Kerbal Space Program,"</em> said said Bryan McLemore, <strong>Curse</strong>'s Author Platform Evangelist.<em> “We also expect the millions of gamers who frequent Curse every month to see Kerbal Space Program as a great addition to our existing community.”</em><br/> *<br/><strong><em>Kerbal Space Program</em></strong> recently won the 2013 Game Developers Choice Audience Award, which is voted online by gamers from all games nominated, including indie and AAA titles. <strong>Kerbal Spaceport</strong>, the home for <strong><em>KSP </em></strong>mods, has more than 2,000 pieces of user-generated content to allow for players to customize their <em>KSP </em>experience. As part of <strong>Curse</strong> <strong>Forge</strong>, modders will now have a bigger audience to share their mods and will have the opportunity to participate in ad-generated revenue sharing.</span></p>

Curse, who sabotaged WoWWiki to promote their own competitor. Curse, who was nearly banned sitewide from reddit for numerous abuses including astroturfing and controlling subreddits for games (they see you, /r/kerbalspaceprogram). Curse, whose ad/malware-laden wikis force out competition to make money. Curse, whose spyware ad installer is distrusted by every smart person. Curse, whose business practices can be described as inspired by Breaking Bad.

This is who you partner with? I'm so disappointed I don't even know what to say except that I hope nobody is dumb enough to use it.
Will there be sub-categories? I don't want to browse through 700 mods of all kinds, when i'm looking only for engines or science parts.

"end of this week" = beginning of next week eh? :> Well nice that the cat's out of the bag, #kspmodders have had to keep #kspofficial in the dark for long enough imo

Excited about this

This is going to suck a whole lot if Curse doesn't do a good job of mitigating bad posting of crap part files and fake mods. Please stay on top of moderation. Please consider allowing a user-to-user voting/karma system.

Edited May 6, 2014 by KasperVld

So, uhm, what about this curse?

Does it have an API to browse mods? What does more than spaceport?

I still dream of a day when mod automatic update will be a thing...

As long as I don't have to get a subscription or have to pay in any other way to get a decent download speed, I am neutral about Curse.

Most likely I'll still be downloading directly from the modders themselves anyway, but I'm just saying.

So.....cursed rocket parts? that will improve my track record.

Hope that this will be better than current systems (forum and spaceport), especially with finding what has updated.

I'm not holding my breath, considering just how horrid of a website Curse.com actually is. (About 30sec to load when all other sites are nearly instant.)

And don't even get me started on the horrid, awful, intentionally crippled Curse client. Only one download at a time and one queued, and you get spammed with an add IN the client that takes up about 1/5 of the window, that you can only make go away by paying for "premium". It gets even better when that becomes a noisy flash ad you can't make go away!

Honestly? They sure live up to their name, the whole site is cursed.

It's not like it's going to affect me much though, I usually grab mods straight from their respective threads and such.
Curse IS a curse.. and so becomes all games partenered with them..

I will just come out and say it: this is a mistake. The stigma of "Curse.com" aside, Spaceport should be a custom-built application tailored specifically for this game because all that's happened is we've trade one watered-down version for another.

Is this Squads way of saying that they just don't want to fuss with creating a real Spaceport site and focus only on the game itself? I can understand that ... maybe we should leave it up to a member of the community to create an unofficial Spaceport 2

Will there be sub-categories? I don't want to browse through 700 mods of all kinds, when i'm looking only for engines or science parts.

A quick check on http://www.curse.com/plugins/kerbal shows lots of catogories, Catogories listed below with sub catogories.

Parts

-C&C

-Misc

-Propulsion

-Structural and Aerodynamic

-Utility and Scientific

Plugins

-Gameplay

-Misc

-Physics

-Resources

-Ship systems

Shareables

-Config tweaks

-Flags and Decal

-Saved games

-Vessels and Ships
